name: Sorcerer's Storm (2022)
description: A digital card game created during the Summer 2022 semester as part of the Intro to Game Design class at the University of Utah.
contributions: Choose a verb and illustrate it with a core mechanic. The verb I chose was "lose" with the mechanic being that every choice has a cost.
Identify a satisfying win condition. My win/loss condition was to break the curse without losing all of your health, items, and team members.

Identify rules, obstacles and challenges. The rules included selecting a team of four characters, draw encounters and roll for them, and a game timer starting with 10 turns. When you reach an obstacle (locks, enemies, traps, skill checks), then you would choose a character to attempt to overcome it. The challenges at this point included unlocking, fighting, or meeting skill requirements.

Bring in a narrative and adjust scope. My narrative was that a sorcerer has brought a storm to the village and you must select four villagers to take on the journey to stop him. There are a limited number of turns to do this. Each obstacle you draw has a stat type that you then roll against using the stat value from the selected character. The game ends when you defeat the sorcerer or he defeats your team.
Implemented a card manager and scripts to handle the selection and placement of character cards.
Implemented character cards that could have different stats.
Implemented encounter cards with a specific stat and the functionality of drawing them.
Implemented the gameplay loop of drawing an encounter, selecting a character, rolling the stat, and updating the character card based on the result.
Implemented a turn tracker that is updated after each draw.
Implemented item cards that can be drawn, selected, and then assigned to boost a character's stats.
Implemented key cards that can be drawn and then used to unlock doors or chests.
Implemented boss encounter that starts on the turn and has a separate deck of encounter cards.
Update character selection to have the player confirm, rather than automatically proceed after last charact is selected.
Resolved issue where cards and button were incorrectly enabled or left on screen.
Refactor code to better handle team and boss data.
